DataElement.preferredName: Cytogenetic Analysis Fluorescence in situ Hybridization Against Genetic Chromosome Mechanism Assessment  Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response to a question that asks if a cytogenticist will assist with the analysis of the FISH patterns and results against the genetic/chromosonal mechanism and the processing of the cells that could confound the results.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cytogenetic Analysis Fluorescence In Situ Hybridization Against Genetic Chromosome Mechanism Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Techniques for analysis of chromosomal and subchromosomal properties and structures, such as those to diagnose, classify, screen for, or manage genetic diseases and abnormalities.:A physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin. This technique can be used for identification of chromosomal abnormalities and for gene mapping._In opposition to or in competition with someone or something._Having to do with information that is passed from parents to offspring through genes in sperm and egg cells._A structure found in cells that is comprised of a strand of linearized double-stranded DNA plus proteins that package the DNA in a condensed coil form and regulate chromosomal function._The means by which an effect is obtained._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Techniques for analysis of chromosomal and subchromosomal properties and structures, such as those to diagnose, classify, screen for, or manage genetic diseases and abnormalities.

Concepts.definition: Techniques for analysis of chromosomal and subchromosomal properties and structures, such as those to diagnose, classify, screen for, or manage genetic diseases and abnormalities.

Property.preferredName: Fluorescence In Situ Hybridization Against Genetic Chromosome Mechanism Assessment
Property.preferredDefinition: A physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin. This technique can be used for identification of chromosomal abnormalities and for gene mapping._In opposition to or in competition with someone or something._Having to do with information that is passed from parents to offspring through genes in sperm and egg cells._A structure found in cells that is comprised of a strand of linearized double-stranded DNA plus proteins that package the DNA in a condensed coil form and regulate chromosomal function._The means by which an effect is obtained._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: A physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin. This technique can be used for identification of chromosomal abnormalities and for gene mapping.
In opposition to or in competition with someone or something.
Having to do with information that is passed from parents to offspring through genes in sperm and egg cells.
A structure found in cells that is comprised of a strand of linearized double-stranded DNA plus proteins that package the DNA in a condensed coil form and regulate chromosomal function.
The means by which an effect is obtained.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator of Yes, No, or Unknown to represent a condition.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: DCTD (Division of Cancer Treatment and Diagnosis)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Will a cytogeneticist assist
ReferenceDocuments.description: Will a cytogeneticist assist with the interpretation of the FISH patterns/results vs. the genetic/chromosomal mechanisms and/or artifacts of processing/cell overlaps that can confound the FISH results
